data.title: Playbill: Broadway, Off-Broadway, London News, Listings and Tickets
data.text:
Christopher Renshaw, who conceived the musical with Andrew Delaplaine, will direct the show about the famed trumpet player.

Adapted from Nicholas Sparks' novel and its 2004 film, the work features a book by Bekah Brunstetter and a score by Ingrid Michaelson.

The concept album, adapted from the 1979 cult film, will be released in October.

See the Playbill covers for Romeo + Juliet, McNeal, and more shows coming to New York this fall.

Mr. Epstein was among the producers for the 2003 Tony-winning Best Musical Hairspray.

The cult favorite musical is now available in a special version for performers 18 and under.

The outdoor adventure, featuring over 8,300 square feet of light installations, will bring characters from the classic Disney film to life.

On the opening night of the Broadway revival of the classic musical, Rachel Dratch, Andrew Rannells, Ingrid Michaelson, and more were on the red carpet.

The comedian returns to Fringe to ask the question: Can death be funny?

Shah's brilliant show about being Indian in Britain will be on Netflix after its Fringe run.

Her crackling solo show, Whore’s Eye View, is a mad dash primer through 10,000 years of sex worker history.

A rundown of current Broadway shows and their planned show times, as well as cancellations due to COVID.

Keep track of the shows booked into each Broadway theatre.

The hit revival will ease on down the road for a national tour.

Hadestown's Jordan Fisher is the executive producer for the three-person drama set in the near future.

What if the empty black void of the unknown wasn't something to be feared, but a friend?

Feldman joined the hit Off-Broadway revival as Seymour in May, alongside Sarah Hyland as Audrey.

Lyndon Chapman writes and stars in a devastating new play about queer life on the sidelines.

Also, watch Emily Skinner perform "A Letter From Harry's Mother" from the Tony-nominated musical.

The play from Daisy Hall explores life at the end of the world.

The three-time Tony winner recently returned to the famed concert venue with A Life in Notes.

Inspired by Glasgow's "Willy's Chocolate Experience" debacle, the parody musical is currently running.

See what’s coming soon, what’s premiering out of town, and what’s in development.

This show from Japan's Cirquework combines circus arts and techno.
